pageContext.claim: “More and more people are suggesting that Republicans (and me) should be given Equal Time on T.V. when you look at the one-sided coverage.”
pageContext.analysis: The Fairness Doctrine, which required broadcasters to air contrasting views regarding controversial matters of public interest, was repealed in 1987 during the Reagan administration. The repeal helped foster the rise of right-leaning television and radio programs, presumably a development the president supports.
